Package com.teksystems.salestaxexercise

Interface Taxable

All Known Subinterfaces:
TaxableBasket, TaxableItem
All Known Implementing Classes:
TaxableBasketImpl, TaxableItemImpl
public interface Taxable
Defines the interface for any object that has taxes associated with it Not just individual items or goods that are taxable, but also collections of taxable goods
Author:
Andrew

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.LinkedHashMap<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> getTaxAmounts()
    The SOLID design principle that interfaces should wherever possible depend on other interfaces, not concrete classes, would suggest this should return a Map, not a LinkedHashMap.
    org.joda.money.Money getTotalPriceWithTax()  
    org.joda.money.Money getTotalTax()  

  • Method Details

    • getTaxAmounts

      java.util.LinkedHashMap<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> getTaxAmounts()
      The SOLID design principle that interfaces should wherever possible depend on other interfaces, not concrete classes, would suggest this should return a Map, not a LinkedHashMap. However, because some taxes may be assessed on top of other taxes, maintaining the order of taxes may be very important in many implementations. I decided the benefits of forcing every implementer to implement with a structure that maintains order outweighed the potential loss in flexibility.
      Returns:
      the list of taxes and amounts for this taxable object

    • getTotalTax

      org.joda.money.Money getTotalTax()

    • getTotalPriceWithTax

      org.joda.money.Money getTotalPriceWithTax()
